citeinfo.title: Flux Tower Eddy Covariance and Meteorological Measurements for Barrow, Alaska: 2012-2016

descript.abstract:
The dataset contains half-hourly eddy covariance flux measurements and determinations, companion meteorological measurements, and ancillary data for the period 2012 to 2016 from the flux tower (US-NGB) on the Barrow Environmental Observatory at Barrow (Utqiagvik), Alaska. Data have been processed using EddyPro software and screened by the contributor. The flux tower sits in an Arctic coastal tundra ecosystem. Dataset DOI:10.5440/1362279; http://dx.doi.org/10.5440/1362279
This dataset supersedes the previously released dataset "Eddy-Covariance and auxiliary measurements, NGEE-Barrow, 2012-2013" DOI:10.5440/1124200. This new product includes data for the longer time period, 2012-2016, that have been processed using consistent methods for the entire record.
descript.purpose: Data were collected to quantify and characterize radiation and GHG fluxes in order to improve understanding of the drivers influencing these fluxes and ultimately to better represent these processes in Earth System Models.

theme.themekey: CH4 flux, latent heat flux, sensible heat flux, water vapor flux, air temperature, CO2 concentration, relative humidity, PAR, photosynthetically active radiation, incoming solar radiation, incoming shortwave radiation, incoming longwave radiation, net radiation, outgoing longwave radiation, outgoing shortwave radiation, soil temperature,

dataqual.logic: The dataset was subjected to numerous QA/QC checks by the contributor including range checks, spike detection, property-property checks, time series analyses, etc. The dataset was also submitted to the AmeriFlux archive at LBNL and will be subjected to the AmeriFlux automated QA/QC routines.

method.methdesc: EddyPro software was used for data processing to produce 30 minute data from measured voltages.

cntperp.cntorg: Next-Generation Ecosystem Experiments (NGEE) Arctic Project, Oak Ridge National Laboratory

metainfo.metstdn: FDGC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata and Biological Data Profile
